<title
    level="1"
    right="Weapon 0"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Jiu Huan Dao](/Weapons.aspx?ID=288)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Sweep" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=194" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Tian Xia Character Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=230) pg. 127, [Gods & Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=17) pg. 121 <sup>2.0</sup>, [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 27 <sup>2.0</sup>

_[**PFS Note**](/pathfinder-society) Characters from Tian Xia have access to this option_

**Favored Weapon** [Hei Feng](/Deities.aspx?ID=307)

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 9 sp

**Damage** 1d8 S

**Bulk** 1
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Hands** 1

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Type** Melee

**Category** Martial

**Group** [Sword](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=15)
</row>

</column>

---

This sword has a broad blade, along which are threaded nine heavy metal rings, leading some to call it the nine-ring sword. The rings add weight to the weapon for broad swings and clash together to make noise.

<title level="2">Critical Specialization Effects</title>

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 283 <sup>4.0</sup>

Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make a Strike with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

[Click here for the full rules on Critical Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=235).

<document level="2" id="weapon-group-15" />
name: Jiu Huan Dao
